A wonderful app. I've been using Virtual Tablet with a USB connection, so far I haven't faced any problems. I use it to take online classes and its blast to work on as the interface is very simple and user friendly, which enables me to work efficiently. I highly recommend this app. Truly one of a kind.

Really great app. I have connected this to my Samsung galaxy note 2014 edition and it works brilliantly. As long as you have set the correct permissions in the firewall (test this with the lite version) it will work over wifi very well. It also works over USB which is very useful. I love that as I hover my S pen over the tablet, I can see the cursor move, exactly like a graphics tablet. However the added benefit is you can see what you write on the tablet. I use this for doing online tutoring and it works very well. A few things that would make it better would be some hotkeys (such as an undo/redo button - i guessed mapped to CTRL-Z and CTRL-Y) and maybe any other useful keys. This could be available on the side if the active area is made smaller in the settings, or at the top of the screen (wherever it could fit) Also Multi screen support for windows, maybe where you can choose the screen you are working on very easily (it would be impractical for the tablet to cover several screens at once, I like the fact that you can cover one screen completely. Overall Great App, Thank you!
You have to buy the android and the windows app. Trying to contact the support but the forum is down.

content: why rarely connect and always unexpected network over usb?

Took a bit to configure. Mac OS Sierra did not come with adb installed. Thankfully I already had brew installed, and getting adb was only a couple commands a way. I also had to switch out the USB cable I was using, but once I grabbed a different micro USB cable and installed adb the tablet picked up right away. It's really slow over bluetooth, but I didn't intend to use it that way. Wifi works good, but I had to go into Photoshop and disable hardware acceleration, and turn down the amount of history levels to give a performance bump. It worked well. Using over USB is definitely the best option I've found. Play with the Pressure Sensitivity in the Server settings to find a pressure level that works well with your hands and tablet.
replyContent: Thank you for your review! If you find anything that we can improve the app, please let us know!

content: I would really really love 2-screen support. Every other thing is great!

content: I use a Samsung Galaxy Note Pro 12.2 (AT&T) and this worked perfectly with my s-pen. Pressure sensitivity works great in sketchbook pro on win 10 64-bit. I also use it inside Maya/Z Brush for sculpting. Will there be any update to allow finger touch recognition while using bluetooth/WiFi modes in order to interact with canvas (move/zoom/pan)? How about screen mirroring? It does work (move/zoom/pan) via s-pen with small learning curve. The s-pen button does work to recognize the click-hold functions of sketchbook pro desktop version. Keep it coming! THUMBS UP! **Note to devs: take a look at Slide by Loren K, he has great features you could implement since he made his an open source app. It has the USB functionality, just gotta decipher his coding in android studio and scala/sbt languages. ** (01/06/17) NEW-How do you change the "selected screen" option?
replyContent: Ohh! we... currently don't provide the feature yet T.T .. We plan to support multi screen feature soon! We will let you know!

content: This program is very good (Bluetooth, an wifi)!!, however never let me connect with USB wire.

This app is very useful for someone that doesn't want to spend the cost of a real digitizer tablet. Even if you own one, you could use your phone if you're on a trip and left the tablet at home. Everything works seamlessly; pressure sensitivity, mirror mode, USB connection and even a right click when long pressing some elements in Windows 10.  One thing you should know, If you're having issues with USB connection, make sure you have your phone's driver installed and that you are opening the server app after you connect your phone in mtp mode. So the app can initiate the interface for USB connection.
Works a treat with my 10.1 note and set up was easy

Tried the free version very impressed intended to purchase. Paid for upgrade. Could not upgrade server - uninstalled and reinstalled from website - ok. Connected wifi direct as previously... Nothing. Tried different modes.. No response. Switched on logging. Pen positiom, pressure and mask are being logged but no response on the notebook on which server was installed. Reinstalled (again)  and restarted both devices. No joy.  Will sek refund but will certainly re purchase immediately there is a resolution.   Tried re-installation after uninstalling and receiving refund (thankyou). This however still failed after reinstallation and repurchase. I have uninstalled again but do not appear to have received a refund - please apply this and I will come back after your next upgrade and try again  Please note:I have uploaded a snippet from server log file to your sunny soft website.
replyContent: Okay... Seems like you did everything we usually instruct our users to do. Please check the server version, it should be 3.0.1 . Neither USB version  works correctly?

replyContent: Sorry for the inconvenience! I assume your desktop is connected to LAN? Then you should user your desktop as Wifi router to connect your mobile device. (two devices should share the same network ) Then it should work fine! if it does not work, please update the review! Hope it works!

replyContent: Hello! Please update the newer version! We provide size from 40%! Also, try connecting via USB tethering or hotspot tethering (mobile device -> PC). Keep up and enjoy drawing!

content: You need to download the servers side files for PC for it to work people.

Nice concept, but not satisfying.   1)  Bluetooth pairing seems to be broken, which makes it useless in many public (i.e., coffee shop) settings.   2)  IP pairing works, but inexplicably the next notification after pairing on the screen is rotated by 180 degrees-- infuriating.
replyContent: Hello, we know that bluetooth paring is somewhat unstable.. we will improve the feature! We rotated the screen in such way that your right hand does not interfere with the hardware back button. Thank you!

content: Thought it would work and I thought it started working but No. Don't waste your money
replyContent:
Thank you for downloading VirtualTablet!
It does support Note 5! 
Please make sure you have also downloaded the server program for your computer! Also, check your computer and mobile device are connected to the same Wifi! Go to http://www.sunnysidesoft.com/virtualtablet/how-to/ for more information!

content: I will be very thankful if this application could be used with my Galaxy Tab A, please T T
replyContent: We are so sorry T.T we only support devices with Wacom stylus pen!

content: I tried to use it and it's so laggy it's not working.
replyContent: If it is too laggy, please try to put wifi router as close as possible or try USB tethering! If you really want refund, please contact Google. We feel sorry that you were not satisfy with Virtual Tablet.

content: Love it

I'm so happy to finally find an app that helps me utilize my galaxy note in the final stages of work. My intuos broke on me a year ago and I didn't want to buy another one when I had my s-pen.  This bridges the gap in me planning something and getting the finished work done.  I can't wait to see any future upgrades (USB please?)
replyContent: Hello! We are aware that many users need USB connection. It is on our to-do list, so please keep up with current version and we will come back with better version of Virtual Tablet! Thank you.

content: Works fairly good. Messing around with drawing on my Note 5.  Some delay in strokes when using the S-Pen.  Being able to use a USB would make this perfect.  But it's good for the price.  Using on a Windows 10 pc
replyContent: Hello! USB connection is on our to-do list. Thank you!

content: I get absolutely no pen pressure sensitivity on my Windows 10 Laptop pc using this app on Samsung Galaxy Note Pro 12.2 over a wireless BT fibre optic broadband connection. Isn't S-pen pressure sensitivity on your pc the whole point of this app!!?? If SunnysideSoft has a potential solution to this issue please let me know and if I get S-pen pressure sensitivity, I'll upgrade my review. Otherwise it's not performing the function that it was advertised to do....
replyContent: Hello, It works on Sketchbook Pro and we stated that on App description and our website. Pressure sensitivity for Adobe series is not supported yet but we are working on the feature. Pressure sensitivity for Mac version is done and we are working on the Windows version! Thank you for your patience!

content: Great!! Does need an inverse option, or a rotate screen option, because 10"tablets and up use landscape mode, and thus your hand is on the softkeys. There is no pressure sensitivity in Adobe programs, but that's due to Adobe's drivers. Connecting to my laptop was a bit of a nightmare (Bluetooth on Windows always is), but closing and re-launching the driver client worked like a charm. There is a slight delay, but it's still a vast improvement over a mouse. I've got a 12.2" NotePro and a Note 3. Guess how happy I am right now..!! :D
replyContent: We are so glad you are satisfied with our app! On setting, you can switch the direction of your screen (left/right hand mode). And you are right, Adobe series has driver problem.. and we are working hard with it! It will be updated soon. So please keep up with Virtual Tablet!

content: Aside from getting my hopes up to save money on a real drawing tablet, I couldn't get it to connect via wifi nor Bluetooth  (and my phones always Bluetooth connected to my pc). Maybe it's the windows 10 os? Maybe it's my note 4 edge? Idk.
replyContent:
Thank you for downloading VirtualTablet!
Please make sure you have also downloaded the server program for your computer! Also, check your computer and mobile device are connected to the same Wifi! Go to http://www.sunnysidesoft.com/virtualtablet/how-to/ for more information!

content: The only reason why this gets a 4 star is that they have usb drivers left to work on. The lag over 5 ghz wifi is not but could be much worse, I imagine that with a wired connection it would be onpar with wacoms stuff. The pressure feature dose not work in Adobes PH or SAI paint tool, but it works very well in Autodesk Sketchbook pro, just a heads up. Also I noticed that the power draw is extremely minimal, I get over 8 h of drawing in one charge. Good app and worth the money!
replyContent: Thank you! We are working on Adobe series driver program.. We think we can provide the feature within the end of this year! So please keep up with our app! Thank you!

content: Doesn't support Note 5
replyContent:
Thank you for downloading VirtualTablet!
It does support Note 5!
Please make sure you have also downloaded the server program for your computer! Also, check your computer and mobile device are connected to the same Wifi! Go to http://www.sunnysidesoft.com/virtualtablet/how-to/ for more information!

content: Besides from some very minor delay (I'm talking milliseconds, this app works flawlessly. The PC server app didn't work too well at first, as it was showing the IP for my virtualbox virtual machine installation as opposed to my actual IP, but once I figured it out I was able to connect to it without a problem. I use it for things like Photoshop and games like Soundodger are nice to play using this rather than a mouse. I'm using the Galaxy Note 4 and have no issues with the pressure sensitivity either.

Does not have pressure sensitive detection like my note 4 stylus uses. Its a good app for beginners who can't afford a graphics tablet. I use it  when I'm not home around my actual graphics tablet and need some extra precision over a mouse.   I would rather use my graphics tablet because it has pressure sensitivity detection but as I said great app and if I'm at school and need that precise input this is the app to use.

I paid for the app on my Note 4 and my PC running Windows 10. I cannot get them to connect, and after restarting my PC, the Virtual Tablet Server app is not showing that I have a paid license. I've tried Bluetooth and IP address, but NOTHING!
Please work on USB connection, it would decrease the input delay i guess, overall very good
This app has huge potential but running over WiFi gave me a lot of lag on communication. Made drawing near impossible. Would like to try again over Bluetooth once I have a dongle for my pc.

It lags much on my Note 4. It seems there is no "Color Variation" setting in the app setting panel as mentioned in the website How-to purportedly so solve this problem. Kindly solve this asap. Thanks.

The app works really well for drawing on a computer. It would be nice if you could flip the orientation upside down so your hand isn't resting on the back/home buttons, or so you can use a folding cover to prop it up.
replyContent:
Thank you for downloading VirtualTablet!
You can change the orientation in setting menu by changing the right hand / left hand mode!

content: Photoshop pressure is go! 5 stars for a very good appy.
one's connected the screen is upside-down witch I really don't like. let the user decide how the screen rotation should be.
Works great, connects easily, really useful!
Love it
Ive downloaded the necessary things but it wont work (samsung galaxy note 10.1 with s-pen please help or fix this!
It won't  detect server. I'm using note 4. And windows 8.1

Great app for my note 2 and 10.1, I've tried the free version before on 1.2 but it was dreadful and far from smooth. It got me hooked at 2.0 though. This is a very worthy app with input lag close to a desktop mouse. I'm sure Wacom didn't see this coming.       Some very minor issues/suggestions: I do miss the ability to change size more extensively like in the previous version, because now it doesn't cover the navbar in cyanogenmod's extended desktop mode. An option to configure a dead-zone (for example: pen activates after 30% pressure) would also be nice. And please do something about the screen orientation jumping around. Finally, when not touching the screen for a while, pen hovering is sometimes not transmitted.
Unable to connect on wifi

Most useful with Autodesk sketchbook and Digicel Flipbook because the S pen pressure works. Room for improvement. USB support might improve accuracy, freezing and lag issues caused by wireless connection. Better than the competition. Why is the app upside-down on the screen? Price is very reasonable.

Galaxy Note Pro 12.2 via WiFi (within 7 ft).  It runs much more efficiently since I last tried it about half a year back.  I was actually able to use it in Photoshop without a hitch.    Only quirk I can call is screen orientation but it doesn't take away at all from performance.  Icing on the cake: Cintiq Companion link-like capability!  Also loving the real-estate I can choose (I prefer 100% but I may adjust that at some point).  I'm uncertain if this can be circumvented, but if I'm touching the tablet I can't use touch gestures on my touchscreen monitor.  Quick lift of my hand remedies the problem, however.

Tried the free one and had a little issue getting the BT working but after restart of laptop and phone it works.  Perfect timing because my old wacom tablet just stopped working...its usb cord has a short.   Almost bought a new wacom just to use for signing docs and occasional drawing but this does what I need.   5 stars if BT connection keeps working without an issue.
Works well with my galaxy note 4
impossible to draw :(
It works very perfectly in lightroom, I'm looking forward for photoshop!

Does not matter if I'm using bluetooth or WiFi connection with Note 10.1. This device appears to have support for the Note 10.1, but that is not the reality right now. Emailing support for resolution or refund. There seem to be so few options for my own personal human error, so i'm chalking it up to the app not working. Things i noticed: PC shows the Note 10.1, says its connected, Tablet agrees, and displays the drawing area, but nothing moves on the screen, S Pen is working, because i can see the S Pen Dot when hovering/ Pressing. PC does not recognize it as an input device under "Bluetooth Services". Only gives services as Music and File Transfer. Not sure if any of this is helpful.
VT always uses second monitor, is there an option to select the monitor somewhere? Can't seem to find it. Great app.
Works well with Sketchbook. There is still some momentary lag. I have to set the server IP manually in the app, it's not able to detect my PC automatically.
On my Samsung Galaxy Note 4 and Photoshop. I'm very pleased that pressure  sensitivity worked instantly.
Loving the functionality so far. Keen for updates.
I followed the instructions carefully and still no luck. I emailed your support team. Waiting for your feedback..

On the one hand it's only $1.86, on the other hand the stylus stops working suddenly and then starts working again. I'm going to try plugging in the usb cord and seeing if that works better. (That's tethering right?) Also, I really wish what I was drawing would show up on the tablet as well as the computer instead of just on the computer screen.

Pressure sensitivity doesnt work in Photoshop or Illustrator on Mac or PC. Incredibly latent. Needs alot of work. Wouldnt recommend buying the paid version. tracking is also bad, if you lift the pen off the screen it stops tracking and you have to touch the screen again for it to track. Galaxy Note3, Mac OSX Mountain Lion, Windows 7 Enterprise.

Handy little app. Does what it says on the most part, but the only program I've been able to get the pressure sensitivity working with is 3D Coat. Which works awesomely well and is super sensitive. No such joy with Photoshop, Gimp, Krita, Sketchbook Pro/Designer (as per the product description) or anything else though. Implement support for other software and I'd happily give 5*
does not work how it should. Only able to go to navigate in the middle of the screen.

It was useful with my GALAXY Note 10.1, but I've detected a problem with pen pressure setting with Adobe Photoshop CS6. It can't set and detect the pen pressure while I try to testing it. PLEASE fix this problem and update to make this app better. :)
Sometimes the point in the screen gets lost. But everything else is fine
Could not get client server communication and there is no trouble shooting docs or even user instructions for any of it.
This is a cool idea , but it lags a lot. It also randomly disconnect . If you fix the lag it will be a great app.

Great performance on my Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition... although the app could use more settings for customization (disable zoom, overflow border on tablet draw space..etc) The app also seems to lose the connection to my PC if I pick the pen up too far. I then have to tap on the screen to get my mouse cursor to "wake up" causing me to inadvertently click on something or make a mark on my painting. If these were fixed, it'd easily be a 5 star app!
Works good on my Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition.  Can now draw on tablet with several PC art apps.

Good performance on Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition. However, no stylus pressure working at all, so I am waiting for the new driver for Photoshop as developer said it can support pressure input ... (test with Photoshop extend 64 bit and Manga Studio Ex 5)....  For now it's just good but not great..  - Is there any way to turn off screen while operating? I dont know if the screen off then device still be able to accept s-pen input or not...(probably not)
Makes the unit overheat, it draws that much current.
This app makes my Note 2 even more useful. I use Zbrush and Photoshop a lot and having tablet input is so helpful. Add to that accurate and this app is a must have. And so inexpensive!
Good app but does not always pick up the pen
Does just what it says.
not bad

I was a little weary about using this at first due to its lack of presence on the market... but after installation and such it seems to be working. The app was unable to auto-detect my computer but did manage to connect through manually. Unfortunately it tends to lag off and on over WiFi... which could affect others give or take based on their signal. Server software comes with unexplained/unmentioned "Flicks" software which seems to control the advanced controls of the stylus... though it doesn't really explain how.  I do wish the tablet working area could be scaled to the screen or scaled smaller... using it on my SGS Note 10.1 I found myself moving my entire arm just to move my cursor... though it could be accelerated in settings. Alternatively a descaled interface that works akin to a touch pad would be nice. All-in-all not bad. If the performance were improved it would be considerably better. Bonus points for pressure sensitivity. 3/5
